text: Annuity Plan - Heirs Insurance Group Annuity Plan - Heirs Insurance Group About Us Heirs Life Heirs General Heirs Insurance Brokers News Digital Channels Careers Partnerships Products Personal & Family Travel & Logistics SMEs & Corporates Retirees & Seniors Health Education Creative Sector Fast Claims Heirs General Claims Heirs Life Claims Pay Premium Heirs Life Premium Heirs General Premium Lifestyle CSR & Sustainability Essay Championship Travel Festival Retirees Club Rewards Blog Movies Magazine Insights Contact Locations Contact Us Complaints FAQs Verify Car Policy Log-in General Self Service Life Self Service Inconnect/Resellers’ Login Brokers Portal Annuity Plan The Heirs Life Pension-regulated Annuity plan is specially designed for retirees aged 50 and above who want to earn a steady, life-long income, after retirement. At retirement, you are given the option to transfer your pension funds to purchase an Annuity plan. If you buy the Heirs Life Annuity plan, we pay you a steady income for as long as you live. Unlike Programmed withdrawals (Pension) which pays you until you exhaust your retirement savings balance, Annuity keeps paying you a steady amount for life and does not get exhausted. If there is loss of life within the first 10 years of the policy,

text: steady income for as long as you live. Unlike Programmed withdrawals (Pension) which pays you until you exhaust your retirement savings balance, Annuity keeps paying you a steady amount for life and does not get exhausted. If there is loss of life within the first 10 years of the policy, the balance is prorated and paid as a bulk amount to your beneficiary. This way, your hard-earned money still stays with your loved ones. Already insured? Heirs takes care of everything. Sign up to Heirs and our team will do the rest. We guarantee a seamless transition from your former contract to your new Heirs contract, without double coverage or risk of interruption. Talk to Heirs See Packages SHARE : Annuity Retirees Age Limit: 50 and above Contribution Frequency: Once Annuity benefit: A steady amount paid to the annuitant (retiree) for life or until death happens Annuity Payment Frequency: Monthly or Quarterly Financial support to your beneficiary if death occurs within the first 10 years of the policy: The prorated Annuity balance. Document Requirements A clear copy of passport photographs (compulsory). One copy of valid means of identification (compulsory). One copy of proof of residence dated in the last six months (compulsory). Retirement letter from the last place of employment (compulsory). Evidence of age (if DOB is not provided on the means of identification) (compulsory). The RSA statement/template (optional, if the premium amount, RSA PEN and PFA name is correctly stated on the proposal form). On the third requirement, the client may use the following: Their utility bill - light, waste disposal, water etc. Tenancy receipt/agreement that bears their residential address. Levy receipt that bears their residential address. What is Retiree Life Annuity? This is a stream of income purchased from a life insurance company with the available RSA balance under the CPS as premium. text: receipt that bears their residential address. What is Retiree Life Annuity? This is a stream of income purchased from a life insurance company with the available RSA balance under the CPS as premium. It provides a guaranteed periodic income (pension) to a retiree throughout his/her life after retirement. Annuity is guaranteed for ten years. If the retiree dies within the first ten years of taking up the Heirs Annuity plan, the named beneficiary on the policy is paid the present value of the balance outstanding in the guaranteed period. How can Annuity be purchased? A retiree can buy annuity by remitting his/her available RSA balance as premium to a Retiree Life Annuity Provider (Life Insurance Company) with the commitment to provide the monthly/quarterly annuity payments for life. Who regulates Retiree Life Annuity? The Regulations on RLA are jointly issued by the National Insurance Commission (NAICOM) and the National Pension Commission (PenCom). Contributory Pension Scheme (CPS) Retirement Pack The Retiree Pack is a guide to help prospective retirees make informed decision. Retirees are advised to carefully go through this Pack with the view to making informed decision on the mode of receiving their retirement benefits under the Contributory Pension System (CPS).

text: (PenCom). Contributory Pension Scheme (CPS) Retirement Pack The Retiree Pack is a guide to help prospective retirees make informed decision. Retirees are advised to carefully go through this Pack with the view to making informed decision on the mode of receiving their retirement benefits under the Contributory Pension System (CPS). Can I choose PW and later change to RLA? A retiree on PW can change to RLA. How can the change of RLA be effected? A retiree can request the PFA to transfer his RSA balance to his chosen Retiree Life Annuity Provider (RLA Provider), given the PFA one month notice. Can I change from RLA to PW? A retiree on RLA cannot change to PW. This is because RLA is for life. Can a retiree on RLA change his RLA Provider? A retiree on RLA can change his RLA Provider after at least two years of being with the current RLA Provider with the approval of NAICOM. Can RLA be exhausted? The rist having been transferred to the RLA provider, RLA cannot be exhausted. Where can a retiree on RLA take his complaint to? A retiree on RLA is expected to take his/her complaint to the RLA provider for

text: current RLA Provider with the approval of NAICOM. Can RLA be exhausted? The rist having been transferred to the RLA provider, RLA cannot be exhausted. Where can a retiree on RLA take his complaint to? A retiree on RLA is expected to take his/her complaint to the RLA provider for resolution. However, where the retiree is not satisfied with the response of the RLA provider, he/she can seek the intervention of NAICOM. How does lumpsum affect the Annuity payout of a retiree? The higher the lumpsum received the lower the available RSA balance for the premium, therefore lower monthly/quarterly annuity and vice versa.
